definition: to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive

sentences.english: Mark couldn't pay his bill, so he asked the owner to put it on the cuff.
sentences.chinese: 馬克付不起帳了，就向店主賒賬。

sentences.english: You can have this on account.
Assume that a business estimates that 1 percent of sales on account will be uncollectible.
sentences.chinese: 假設，一個公司估計有1%的賒賬銷貨款將收不回來。

sentences.english: Your store bill is too high, we just can't finance you any longer.
sentences.chinese: 你在店裏的欠賬太多，我們再也不會讓你賒賬了。

sentences.english: A great and terrible hatred rose up in him for the butchers who had refused him credit.
sentences.chinese: 他恨透了不肯賒賬給他的肉店老闆。

sentences.english: I bought the bike on account.
sentences.chinese: 我賒賬買了這輛自行車。

sentences.english: Our shop only allows people six months credit.
